definition: to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Do you know how many boarders in our school?
sentences.chinese: 你知道我们学校有多少寄宿生吗？

sentences.english: He is an oppidan who boards in a private family.
sentences.chinese: 他是寄宿在私人家庭的寄宿生。

sentences.english: Both borders and day students benefit from the cultural diversity of CA's community.
sentences.chinese: 走读生和寄宿生都得益于学校社区的文化多样性。

sentences.english: Based on the above, I agree with you to bring mobile.
sentences.chinese: 基于以上观点，我赞成寄宿生带手机来学校。

sentences.english: Standing on the floor, a young boarder named Carl was admiring the view.
sentences.chinese: 一位名叫卡尔的寄宿生站在地上，为该情景钦佩不已。

sentences.english: My younger sister was at one time a boarder.
sentences.chinese: 有段时间我妹妹是寄宿生。

sentences.english: Boarders at school live a hard life, much less comfortable than that at home.
sentences.chinese: 寄宿生的日子很辛苦，没有在家舒服。

sentences.english: Boarders should take a package of measures to fulfill it.
sentences.chinese: 寄宿生应该采取一系列措施，完成它。

sentences.english: Standing on the floor, a young 3)boarder named Carl was admiring the view.
sentences.chinese: 一位名叫卡尔的寄宿生站在地上，为该情景钦佩不已。

definition: to attend school as a day student
junior high school/abbr. for 初級中學|初级中学[chu1 ji2 zhong1 xue2]
student of a senior high school
to group students into classes/to divide people (staff members etc) into groups
